data.title: NE Indy Industrial Portfolio
data.meta_description: Learn more about this NE Indy industrial portfolio we are acquiring and learn how you can join us as an investment partner.
data.text:
In order to invest in this asset you must be an accredited investor as defined by the Securities and Exchange Commission, (SEC), here.

Investors must also clear AML (Anti-Money Laundering) and KYC (Know Your Customer) among other regulatory checks before we are able to accept their participation in the offering.

To meet these regulatory requirements, we have have engaged Parallel Markets, an independent third party entity to fulfill this role.

Once you have completed your application to invest, you will get a link to Parallel Markets who will in turn confirm your status as an accredited investor and handle KYC and AML requirements.

Once you are invited to verify your accredited investor status, please watch this short walkthrough video of how to submit your details to Parallel Markets, here.

Key Deal Points

Heritage Capital Group is under contract to acquire two 100% occupied industrial investment properties located in Fort Wayne and Garrett, Indiana. The first asset is a 112,160 SF property located at 4422 Airport Expressway in Fort Wayne, IN and the second asset is a 100,500 SF property located at 817 North Taylor Road in Garrett, IN.

The Properties have a weighted average remaining lease term of 2.87 years.

The Fort Wayne property has four (4) tenants and a WALT of 3.27 years (as of 4/1/2024) and the Garrett asset signed a new three (3) year lease extension with the current tenant, who is the original tenant when the asset was built in 2001 and has been the tenant for over 22 years.

The Properties are located in DeKalb and Allen Counties, with a combined market size of approximately 67.7 million SF of industrial product, with a combined vacancy rate of 4.16%.

The Fort Wayne Property is three minutes from Fort Wayne International Airport and the Garrett asset is 30 minutes north of Fort Wayne and 10 minutes west of Auburn â€“ two strong, diverse industrial markets.

Capitalization

The portfolio is being acquired for approximately $12.5 million at a going in cap rate of 8.49% on Year 1 (4/2024) NOI of approximately $1 million. Total capitalization is $14.3MM (see sources and uses below).

Total debt proceeds to be approximately $8,000,000 (64% LTV) with approximately $6,300,000 of equity of which the Sponsor will be providing a 15% co-invest.

5/27/24 Update: Of the total equity required, $1.75MM is coming in through a TIC 1031 exchange which represents 27.78% of the total equity required. Therefore, this JV offering is for a total of approximately $4,550,000. The Sponsor will have over 15% of the total invested equity between its share of the TIC and the JV offering.

Loan terms are for seven years at 6.89% interest rate with three years of interest only followed by 30 years amortization and flexible prepayment provided by a life insurance company.

Year one Debt Service Coverage Ratio is approx. 1.90x and projected exit year DSCR is 2.30%.

Projected hold period to be 5+ years with projected terminal forward NOI at approximately $1,403,660, an estimated 7.75% exit cap rate yielding a projected exit value of approximately $18,000,000.

Total projected returns to investors are for a 1.9x multiple over the hold period and a projected 16% IRR.

What refinancing or other liquidity events are planned?

At this time, there is no refinancing contemplated during the lifecycle of the project, and no concrete sales date planned. That said, the intent is to hold for 5 years, refinancing is a possibility earlier than that date and, as we always underwrite for the long term, it is possible we may hold the asset for more than 5 years.

Will the General Partner file state tax returns on behalf of Limited Partners ('LPs')?

The operating entity will file all appropriate state and federal tax returns on behalf of the partnership and distribute K-1's to the partners on a timely basis.

How can I make my investment as a Trust?

Yes, you can. Please contact our investor relations team at [email protected] for more information.

Can I do a 1031 exchange?

Possibly. Please contact our investment relations team to discuss further.

05/27/24 - Capitalization section updated to include the following: Of the total equity required, $1.75MM is coming in through a TIC 1031 exchange which represents 27.78% of the total equity required. Therefore, this JV offering is for a total of approximately $4,550,000. The Sponsor will have over 15% of the total invested equity between its share of the TIC and the JV offering.

05/27/24 - Key deal points updated to reflect that in late April, the deal went under contract from being 'in negotiations.'

05/24/24 - Sources and uses updated. See Sources and Uses tab below.

05/24/24 - Cashflow snapshot added. See below.

05/24/24 - Financing assumptions updated. Loan proceeds $8MM vs. $8.125MM, interest rate 6.89% vs. 6.75%, year one DSCR 1.93x vs. 1.90x. For further details, refer to the Debt Financing tab below.

05/24/24 - ZF lease structure has been changed to show that it is NNN not modified gross as previously stated.

05/24/24 - GP co-invest has been corrected to show a 15% co-invest, not 10% as previously indicated.

05/21/24 - Capitalization section updated to read: The portfolio is being acquired for approximately $12.5 million at a going in cap rate of 8.49% on Year 1 (4/2024) NOI of approximately $1 million. Total capitalization is $14.3MM (see sources and uses below).

05/13/24 - Offering documents completely ahead of official launch, May 21. Note two classes as follows:

Class A - $50,000 minimum investment, 8% preferred return.

Class B - $1 million minimum investment, 9% preferred return.

Please contact Irwin Boris at [email protected] if you would like to join Class B investors.
